labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to facilitate seamless integration and management of Google Drive resources through standardized protocols. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for interacting with files, folders, permissions, and storage features within Google Drive. Core functionalities include file manipulation (upload, download, delete, move), sharing and permission management, metadata retrieval, version control, and collaborative features like comments and replies. The server acts as a bridge between LLM applications and Google Drive, abstracting the complexity of Drive's API into a streamlined set of tools.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around file and folder management within the Google Drive ecosystem, making "File Management" the most appropriate primary label. Secondary labels include "Cloud Services" due to the inherent cloud-based nature of Google Drive and "API Integration" as the server enables interaction with Google Drive's API. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: drive_changes
tools.description: List changes in Drive

startPageToken.description: Token to start listing changes from

tools.name: drive_file_metadata
tools.description: Get metadata of a file

fileId.description: ID of the file to retrieve metadata for

tools.name: drive_folder_children
tools.description: List contents of a folder

folderId.description: ID of the folder to list contents of

tools.name: drive_search
tools.description: Search files in Google Drive

tools.name: drive_file_content
tools.description: Retrieve content of a Google Drive file

fileId.description: ID of the file to retrieve content from

tools.name: drive_create
tools.description: Create file or folder

name.description: Name of the file or folder

tools.name: drive_upload
tools.description: Upload or update file content

fileId.description: ID of the file to update

tools.name: drive_append_text
tools.description: Append plain text to an existing text file in Drive

fileId.description: ID of the file to append to

text.description: Text to append to the file

tools.name: drive_delete
tools.description: Trash or delete a file

fileId.description: ID of the file to delete

tools.name: drive_share
tools.description: Manage file permissions

fileId.description: ID of the file to share

tools.name: drive_comment
tools.description: Add a comment to a file

fileId.description: Id of the file to add the comment to

tools.name: drive_copy
tools.description: Copy a file or folder to a new location

tools.name: drive_rename
tools.description: Rename a file or folder

tools.name: drive_star
tools.description: Star or unstar a file or folder

tools.name: drive_restore
tools.description: Restore a file from the trash

tools.name: drive_versions_list
tools.description: List all versions of a file

tools.name: drive_versions_delete
tools.description: Delete a specific version of a file

tools.name: drive_file_lock
tools.description: Lock or unlock a file to prevent changes (Google Workspace only)

tools.name: drive_shortcut_create
tools.description: Create a shortcut to a file or folder

tools.name: drive_permissions_list
tools.description: List all permissions of a file or folder

tools.name: drive_permission_update
tools.description: Update a user's permission on a file or folder

tools.name: drive_permission_delete
tools.description: Remove a user's access from a file or folder by permission ID

tools.name: drive_permission_add_domain
tools.description: Share file or folder with everyone in a domain

tools.name: drive_permission_add_anyone
tools.description: Allow anyone with the link to access a file or folder

tools.description: List all comments on a file

tools.name: drive_file_delete_comment
tools.description: Delete a comment from a file

tools.name: drive_file_reply_to_comment
tools.description: Reply to a comment on a file

tools.description: List all replies to a comment on a file

tools.name: drive_file_delete_reply
tools.description: Delete a reply to a comment on a file

tools.name: drive_file_move
tools.description: Move a file to different folder(s)

tools.name: drive_file_empty_trash
tools.description: Permanently delete all trashed files

tools.description: List all accessible Shared Drives

tools.description: Get metadata for multiple files in a single request

fields.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include

tools.description: Update permissions for multiple files at once

tools.description: Delete multiple files or folders at once

permanent.description: Whether to delete permanently (true) or move to trash (false)

tools.name: drive_batch_copy
tools.description: Copy multiple files to a destination folder

fileId.description: ID of the file to copy

operations.description: Array of copy operations to perform

tools.name: drive_batch_move
tools.description: Move multiple files to a destination folder

fileId.description: ID of the file to move

removeFromCurrentFolders.description: Whether to remove from current folders (true) or keep in current folders (false)

operations.description: Array of move operations to perform

server_info_crawled.name: Google Drive
server_info_crawled.author: @rishipradeep-think41/google-drive-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless access and management of Google Drive files through a standardized protocol. Facilitate listing, reading, and interacting with Google Drive resources directly from your LLM applications. Simplify integration with Google Drive by exposing its capabilities as MCP tools and resources.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@rishipradeep-think41/google-drive-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
